dfischer.utils

Class DNSHosts

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.DNSHosts

  • public class DNSHosts
extends java.lang.Object
    Map hostnames to IP addresses.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DNSHosts()
      Empty constructor for object transfer.
      DNSHosts(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hostsMap)
      Create a new instance by directly setting the configuration data.
      DNSHosts(java.lang.String hostsFilePath)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted host file. Create a new instance and read the hosts file.
      DNSHosts(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String hostsFilePath)
      Create a new instance and read the hosts file.

    • Method Summary

      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Internal test program.

      Read the object from a stream (w/o the optional hosts file information).

      Write the object to a stream (w/o the optional hosts file information).

      • DNSHosts

        public DNSHosts()
        Empty constructor for object transfer.

      • DNSHosts

        public DNSHosts(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
        java.lang.String hostsFilePath)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new instance and read the hosts file.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        hostsFilePath - absolute or relative path of the hosts file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K

      • DNSHosts

        public DNSHosts(java.lang.String hostsFilePath)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted host file. Create a new instance and read the hosts file.
        Parameters:
        hostsFilePath - absolute or relative path of the hosts file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • DNSHosts

        public DNSHosts(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hostsMap)
        Create a new instance by directly setting the configuration data.
        Parameters:
        hostsMap - a map of all configuration data. key = host name, value = IP address

    • Method Detail

      • getIpAddress

        public java.lang.String getIpAddress(java.lang.String hostName)
        Resolve a host name to an IP address.
        Parameters:
        hostName - the host name to resolve
        Returns:
        the IP address for the host name, or null if the hosts file does not contain such a translation.

      • getHostsMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getHostsMap()
        Get the hosts configuration data.
        Returns:
        the hosts configuration data. Key = host name, value = IP address.

      • getHostsFile

        public java.io.File getHostsFile()
        Get the hosts file with which this instance was constructed.
        Returns:
        the hosts file, or null if no such information is available. Note that the host file is returned "as is" (data may be encrypted).

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.io.DataOutputStream dout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Write the object to a stream (w/o the optional hosts file information).
